walk off.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to leave someone by walking away from them, especially in a rude or angry way
walk off.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Don’t just walk off when I’m trying to talk to you!
walk off.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if you walk off an illness or unpleasant feeling, you go for a walk to make it go away
walk off.translation[0].definitions[1].n: walk off dinner/a meal etc (=go for a walk so that your stomach feels less full)
walk off.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Let’s go out – maybe I can walk this headache off.
walk off.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to stop working as a protest
walk off.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Without new contracts, mine workers will walk off their jobs Thursday.
